compliance_reasoning: The document is a pension life cover scheme rules document that falls under financial services regulation. The document shows some evidence of systems and controls through its structured rules and definitions, but lacks explicit mention of comprehensive systems and controls, processes, policies and procedures specifically designed to ensure compliance with the CENTRAL BANK REFORM ACT 2010 regulations. While it establishes a framework for the scheme's operation, it doesn't explicitly address compliance mechanisms with these specific regulations.
compliance_evidence:
2.1 Commencement and continuation of the scheme
a. If the employer is appointed as the trustee
On or after the start date of the scheme, the trustee will take out a policy with the life office and may, at a later date, change that policy or take out a further policy or policies with the life office for the benefit of the member's dependants.
b. If an Independent trustee is appointed as trustee
On or after the start date of the scheme the employer, on behalf of the independent trustee who will be the legal owner, will take out a policy with the life office and may, at a later date, change that policy or take out a further policy or policies on behalf of the trustee with the life office for the benefit of the member's dependants. Any expenses incurred by the trustee in connection with the scheme will be met by the employer.; 2.5 Pensions Act
The scheme is governed by the Pensions Act. The trustee's duties will be regulated by, and carried out, according to the Pensions Act. In particular the trustee must:
i. register the scheme with the Pensions Authority and pay any fee that may be required in connection with registering it;
ii. give information in relation to the scheme to any person entitled to receive it; and
iii. provide certain information in relation to the scheme, as required under the Pensions Act.; 4.1 The Trustee as Administrator
The employer hereby declares itself as trustee of the scheme and administrator of  the scheme for the purposes of the TCA, unless the employer appoints as trustee(s) and  administrator(s) an organisation or individual(s) named as trustee(s) on the letter of exchange or supplementary letter of exchange. The trustee confirms that it will hold the benefits of the scheme under irrevocable trusts in accordance with the terms of the letter of exchange and the rules. 

The trustee hereby appoints AIB life as registered administrator for the purposes of the Pensions Act. AIB life agrees to prepare, on behalf of the trustee, the annual pension benefit statement for the member. Annual trustee reports and audited accounts are not required for schemes where the only benefit under the scheme is a death benefit in the event that the member dies before normal retirement age.; 4.5 Additional Trustee Powers
The trustee's powers will include, but not be limited to:
•	make arrangements in relation to administration of scheme 
as they see fit;
•	offer and agree to such terms and generally act in such a 
way as appears to them to be fair and just in relation to 
the purpose of the scheme and its proper and efficient 
administration; 
•	make all necessary arrangements for dealing with receipts 
and payments under the scheme and may authorise that 
cheques be drawn or endorsed by such one or more of 
the trustee(s) or by such other person (if any) as they may 
appoint for the purpose and may give, vary or revoke 
instructions as to the custody and disposal of any policies 
and securities and as to the signature of proposal forms and 
certificates of membership and the giving of receipts and 
discharges in connection with the scheme on behalf of the 
trustee(s) and every such receipt and discharge shall be as 
valid and effective as if it were given by the trustee(s);
gap_description: The document lacks explicit mention of systems and controls, processes, policies and procedures specifically designed to ensure compliance with the CENTRAL BANK REFORM ACT 2010 (SECTION 17A) (STANDARDS FOR BUSINESS) REGULATIONS 2025. There is no clear statement about compliance mechanisms, monitoring procedures, or how the entity ensures adherence to regulatory requirements. The document also does not address how any agents acting on behalf of the regulated entity under outsourcing arrangements would comply with these regulations.
gap_recommendations:
1. Add a specific section on regulatory compliance that explicitly addresses systems and controls implemented to ensure compliance with the CENTRAL BANK REFORM ACT 2010 regulations.
2. Include details about monitoring procedures and compliance checks.
3. Specify how the entity ensures that any agents acting on its behalf under outsourcing arrangements comply with these regulations.
4. Develop and document clear policies and procedures for ongoing compliance assessment and reporting.
5. Include reference to regular reviews of systems and controls to ensure they remain effective and up-to-date with current regulations.
regulation_text:
14. A regulated entity shall establish and implement systems and controls, 
processes, policies and procedures for the purpose of ensuring that it, and any 
agent acting on its behalf on the basis of an outsourcing arrangement, complies 
with these Regulations.
source_name: CENTRAL BANK REFORM ACT 2010 (SECTION 17A) (STANDARDS FOR BUSINESS) REGULATIONS 2025
